org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read

Class RTReadUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.RTReadUtils

  • public class RTReadUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utils for handling GATKRead in ReadTools.

        Zero quality character.

      • RAW_BARCODE_TAG

        public static final java.lang.String RAW_BARCODE_TAG
        Default raw barcode tag (as defined in the SAM specs). Corresponds to SAMTag.BC.

      • RAW_BARCODE_QUALITY_TAG

        public static final java.lang.String RAW_BARCODE_QUALITY_TAG
        Default raw barcode tag for qualities (as defined in the SAM specs). Corresponds to SAMTag.QT.

      • RAW_BARCODE_TAG_LIST

        public static final java.util.List<java.lang.String> RAW_BARCODE_TAG_LIST
        Default raw barcode tag (RAW_BARCODE_TAG) as a singleton list.

    • Method Detail

      • extractBarcodesFromReadName

        public static java.lang.String[] extractBarcodesFromReadName(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Extract and remove the barcode from the read name, splitting the barcodes in the read name using RTDefaults.BARCODE_INDEX_DELIMITER. The read will The barcode should be encoded in the Illumina format (not pair-end information included), for example (barcode delimiter in the example is the default): - readName will return an empty array. - readName#ACGT will return (ACGT). - readName#ACGT-TTTT will return (ACGT, TTTT)
        Returns:
        the barcodes in the read name if any; empty array otherwise.

      • getBarcodesFromTags

        public static java.lang.String[] getBarcodesFromTags(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> tags)
        Returns an array that contains the barcodes stored in the provided tags. The tags are splitted by RTDefaults.BARCODE_INDEX_DELIMITER to check if there are more than 1 sequence. If the value for a tag is null (does not exists), this tag is skipped. Note: no validation is performed to check if the tags are real barcodes.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to extract the barcodes from.
        tags - the tags containing the barcodes, in order.
        Returns:
        the barcodes in the provided tags (in order) if any; empty array otherwise.
        See Also:
        if qualities are also needed.

      • getBarcodesAndQualitiesFromTags

        public static org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.String[],java.lang.String[]> getBarcodesAndQualitiesFromTags(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                                                                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> barcodeTags,
                                                                                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> qualityTags)
        Returns an pair of arrays of the same length that contains the barcodes/qualities stored in the provided tags. The tags are splitted by RTDefaults.BARCODE_INDEX_DELIMITER to check if there are more than 1 sequence/quality. If the value for a tag is null (does not exists), this tag is skipped (also the quality without checking). If the quality is empty for the corresponding tag, the quality is filled with ZERO_QUALITY_CHAR to match the same length. Note: no validation is performed to check if the tags are real barcodes/qualities.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to extract the barcodes from.
        barcodeTags - the tags containing the barcodes, in order.
        qualityTags - the tags containing the qualities, in order.
        Returns:
        the barcodes in the provided tags (in order) if any; empty array otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if for a concrete barcode/quality tag, the length is different.
        See Also:
        (GATKRead, List) if qualities are not needed.

      • getRawBarcodes

        public static java.lang.String[] getRawBarcodes(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Returns the raw barcodes from the RAW_BARCODE_TAG tag.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to extract the barcodes from.
        Returns:
        the barcodes in the provided tags (in order) if any; empty array otherwise.

      • addBarcodesTagToRead

        public static void addBarcodesTagToRead(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                        java.lang.String[] barcodes)
        Sets the RAW_BARCODE_TAG tag for a read, joining the barcodes with RTDefaults.BARCODE_INDEX_DELIMITER.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update with the barcodes.
        barcodes - barcodes to use. If the array is empty, no update will be performed.

      • addBarcodeWithQualitiesTagsToRead

        public static void addBarcodeWithQualitiesTagsToRead(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                                     java.lang.String[] barcodes,
                                                     java.lang.String[] qualities)
        Sets the RAW_BARCODE_TAG and RAW_BARCODE_QUALITY_TAG tags for a read, joining the barcodes/qualities with RTDefaults.BARCODE_INDEX_DELIMITER. Note: barcodes and qualities should have the same length.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update with the barcodes.
        barcodes - barcodes to use. If the array is empty, no update will be performed.
        qualities - associated qualities for the barcodes.

      • clearTrimmingPointTags

        public static void clearTrimmingPointTags(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Removes trimming point tags (ReservedTags.ts and ReservedTags.te) on the read. Note: The completely trim tag (ReservedTags.ct) will be updated, but not removed to keep track of completely trim reads.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update.

      • updateTrimmingPointTags

        public static void updateTrimmingPointTags(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                           int start,
                                           int end)
        Updates the trimming tags (ReservedTags.ts, ReservedTags.te and ReservedTags.ct) on a read, with the specified trimming points.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update.
        start - the first trimming point.
        end - the last trimming point.
        See Also:
        updateTrimmingStartPointTag(GATKRead, int), updateTrimmingEndPointTag(GATKRead, int), updateCompletelyTrimReadFlag(GATKRead)

      • updateTrimmingStartPointTag

        public static void updateTrimmingStartPointTag(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                               int start)
        Updates the start trimming tag (ReservedTags.ts) on a read, with the specified trimming points. If the read already have the tag, it conserves the right-most trim point. Note: the completely trim tag (ReservedTags.ct) is not updated.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update.
        start - the first trimming point.

      • getTrimmingStartPoint

        public static int getTrimmingStartPoint(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Returns the trimming start point from the ReservedTags.ts if present; 0 otherwise.

      • updateTrimmingEndPointTag

        public static void updateTrimmingEndPointTag(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                             int end)
        Updates the start trimming tag (ReservedTags.ts) on a read, with the specified trimming points. If the read already have the tag, it conserves the left-most trim point. Note: the completely trim tag (ReservedTags.ct) is not updated.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update.
        end - the last trimming point.

      • getTrimmingEndPoint

        public static int getTrimmingEndPoint(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Returns the trimming end point from the ReservedTags.ts if present; read length otherwise.

      • isCompletelyTrimRead

        public static boolean isCompletelyTrimRead(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Returns false if the ReservedTags.ct is 0 or does not exists; true otherwise. Warning: this method does not take into account the trimming points. If the read is completely trimmed but the ReservedTags.ct was not updated, the method will return false. Use the updateCompletelyTrimReadFlag(GATKRead) for safe retrieval of the tag.

      • updateCompletelyTrimReadFlag

        public static boolean updateCompletelyTrimReadFlag(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Updates the completely trim flag if the read with the start/end trim points, only if the read does not have a value which indicates that is already completely trim (ReservedTags.ct != 0). Based on the trim points, the read is completely trimmed if: - If the ReservedTags.ct is already set to a value different from 0. - If the start point is equals to the read length (ReservedTags.ct = 1). - If the end point is equals to 0 (ReservedTags.ct = 2. - If the start and end points are exactly the same (ReservedTags.ct = 3. - If the start point is after the end (ReservedTags.ct = 3. - If the end point is before the start ((ReservedTags.ct = 3. Otherwise, the read is not completely trimmed (ct=0). If the read is completely trimmed, it will be marked in-place with the ReservedTags.ct tag; otherwise, it will be marked with 0.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to update.
        Returns:
        true if the read is completely trim; false otherwise.

      • fixPairTag

        public static void fixPairTag(java.lang.String tag,
                              org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read1,
                              org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read2)
        Fix a SAM tag that should be in sync for the two reads in a read pair. If it is only present in one of them, set that tag in the other. Note: If it is not set in any or it is in both, they keep this state.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag to fix.
        read1 - first read in the pair.
        read2 - second read in the pair.

      • getReadNameWithIlluminaBarcode

        public static java.lang.String getReadNameWithIlluminaBarcode(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Gets the read name with the raw barcode included into it if they are present (separated with RTFastqContstants.ILLUMINA_NAME_BARCODE_DELIMITER) if present.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to get the information from.
